abstract: Federal Judge Jed S. Rakoff has refused to approve a settlement over Bank of America’s deal with Merrill Lynch.
snippet: Federal Judge Jed S. Rakoff has refused to approve a settlement over Bank of America’s deal with Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission on Wednesday defended its proposed $33 million settlement with Bank of America over bonuses paid to Merrill Lynch executives just before the bank took over Merrill last year.

headline.main: S.E.C. Defends Deal in Merrill Takeover
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Defends Deal in Merrill Takeover

abstract: As the first anniversary of the demise of Lehman Brothers approaches, Breakingviews presents a short list of candidates for the Financial Crisis Undersung Hall of Fame.
snippet: As the first anniversary of the demise of Lehman Brothers approaches, Breakingviews presents a short list of candidates for the Financial Crisis Undersung Hall of Fame.
lead_paragraph: Investors should thank their lucky stars for people like Jed S. Rakoff, Breakingviews.com says. He’s the federal judge taking Bank of America and the Securities and Exchange Commission to task for the agreement they reached to settle allegations that Bank of America kept its shareholders in the dark about bonus payments for Merrill Lynch employees.

headline.main: Some Good Names in a Year Gone Bad
